attributes.action: allow Victoria Cross Gurkha war hero to settle in this country immediately.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Tul Bahadur Pun is a Gurkha, and a World War 2 hero. He fought for this country against the Japanese in Burma.
On 23rd June 1944 he charged enemy machine gun positions after they had cut down most of his comrades.
For this he was awarded the highest award for courage, the Victoria Cross.
Now 84 Mr Pun needs regular medication to survive. To fund this he has to be carried once a month in a basket by a team of men a days walk to collect his meagre £132 British Army pension.
Mr Pun has asked for permission to settle in the UK to give him access to better medical care.
This has been denied him on the grounds he cannot show that treatment here would significantly improve his life.
Mr Pun was willing to give Britain the ultimate sacrifice, let us repay him.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
